1.verse: Blessed is everyone who fears the Lord ,

4.verse: Behold, thus shall the man be blessed

5.verse: The Lord bless you from Zion!

1.verse: “Greatly have they afflicted me from my youth”—

1.verse: Out of the depths I cry to you, O Lord !

3.verse: If you, O Lord , should mark iniquities,

4.verse: But with you there is forgiveness,

1.verse: O Lord , my heart is not lifted up;

2.verse: But I have calmed and quieted my soul,

3.verse: O Israel, hope in the Lord

1.verse: Remember, O Lord , in David's favor,

2.verse: how he swore to the Lord

3.verse: “I will not enter my house

4.verse: I will not give sleep to my eyes

5.verse: until I find a place for the Lord ,

6.verse: Behold, we heard of it in Ephrathah;

7.verse: “Let us go to his dwelling place;

8.verse: Arise, O Lord , and go to your resting place,

9.verse: Let your priests be clothed with righteousness,

10.verse: For the sake of your servant David,

11.verse: The Lord swore to David a sure oath

12.verse: If your sons keep my covenant

13.verse: For the Lord has chosen Zion;

14.verse: “This is my resting place forever;

15.verse: I will abundantly bless her provisions;

16.verse: Her priests I will clothe with salvation,

17.verse: There I will make a horn to sprout for David;

18.verse: His enemies I will clothe with shame,

1.verse: Behold, how good and pleasant it is

2.verse: It is like the precious oil on the head,

3.verse: It is like the dew of Hermon,

1.verse: Come, bless the Lord , all you servants of the Lord ,

2.verse: Lift up your hands to the holy place

3.verse: May the Lord bless you from Zion,

1.verse: Praise the Lord !

2.verse: who stand in the house of the Lord ,

3.verse: Praise the Lord , for the Lord is good;

4.verse: For the Lord has chosen Jacob for himself,

5.verse: For I know that the Lord is great,

6.verse: Whatever the Lord pleases, he does,

7.verse: He it is who makes the clouds rise at the end of the earth,

8.verse: He it was who struck down the firstborn of Egypt,

9.verse: who in your midst, O Egypt,

10.verse: who struck down many nations

11.verse: Sihon, king of the Amorites,

12.verse: and gave their land as a heritage,

13.verse: Your name, O Lord , endures forever,

14.verse: For the Lord will vindicate his people

15.verse: The idols of the nations are silver and gold,

16.verse: They have mouths, but do not speak;

17.verse: they have ears, but do not hear,

18.verse: Those who make them become like them,

19.verse: O house of Israel, bless the Lord !

20.verse: O house of Levi, bless the Lord !

21.verse: Blessed be the Lord from Zion,

1.verse: Give thanks to the Lord , for he is good,

2.verse: Give thanks to the God of gods,

3.verse: Give thanks to the Lord of lords,

4.verse: to him who alone does great wonders,

5.verse: to him who by understanding made the heavens,

6.verse: to him who spread out the earth above the waters,

7.verse: to him who made the great lights,

8.verse: the sun to rule over the day,

9.verse: the moon and stars to rule over the night,

10.verse: to him who struck down the firstborn of Egypt,

11.verse: and brought Israel out from among them,

12.verse: with a strong hand and an outstretched arm,

13.verse: to him who divided the Red Sea in two,

14.verse: and made Israel pass through the midst of it,

15.verse: but overthrew Pharaoh and his host in the Red Sea,

16.verse: to him who led his people through the wilderness,

17.verse: to him who struck down great kings,

18.verse: and killed mighty kings,

19.verse: Sihon, king of the Amorites,

20.verse: and Og, king of Bashan,

21.verse: and gave their land as a heritage,

22.verse: a heritage to Israel his servant,

23.verse: It is he who remembered us in our low estate,

24.verse: and rescued us from our foes,

25.verse: he who gives food to all flesh,

26.verse: Give thanks to the God of heaven,

1.verse: I give you thanks, O Lord , with my whole heart;

2.verse: I bow down toward your holy temple

3.verse: On the day I called, you answered me;

4.verse: All the kings of the earth shall give you thanks, O Lord ,

5.verse: and they shall sing of the ways of the Lord ,

6.verse: For though the Lord is high, he regards the lowly,

7.verse: Though I walk in the midst of trouble,

8.verse: The Lord will fulfill his purpose for me;

1.verse: O Lord , you have searched me and known me!

2.verse: You know when I sit down and when I rise up;

3.verse: You search out my path and my lying down

4.verse: Even before a word is on my tongue,

5.verse: You hem me in, behind and before,

6.verse: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me;

7.verse: Where shall I go from your Spirit?

8.verse: If I ascend to heaven, you are there!

9.verse: If I take the wings of the morning

10.verse: even there your hand shall lead me,

11.verse: If I say, “Surely the darkness shall cover me,

12.verse: even the darkness is not dark to you;

13.verse: For you formed my inward parts;

14.verse: I praise you, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made.

15.verse: My frame was not hidden from you,

16.verse: Your eyes saw my unformed substance;

17.verse: How precious to me are your thoughts, O God!

18.verse: If I would count them, they are more than the sand.

19.verse: Oh that you would slay the wicked, O God!

20.verse: They speak against you with malicious intent;

21.verse: Do I not hate those who hate you, O Lord ?

22.verse: I hate them with complete hatred;

23.verse: Search me, O God, and know my heart!

24.verse: And see if there be any grievous way in me,

1.verse: Deliver me, O Lord , from evil men;

2.verse: who plan evil things in their heart

3.verse: They make their tongue sharp as a serpent's,

4.verse: Guard me, O Lord , from the hands of the wicked;

5.verse: The arrogant have hidden a trap for me,

6.verse: I say to the Lord , You are my God;

7.verse: O Lord , my Lord, the strength of my salvation,

8.verse: Grant not, O Lord , the desires of the wicked;

9.verse: As for the head of those who surround me,

10.verse: Let burning coals fall upon them!

11.verse: Let not the slanderer be established in the land;

12.verse: I know that the Lord will maintain the cause of the afflicted,

13.verse: Surely the righteous shall give thanks to your name;

1.verse: O Lord , I call upon you; hasten to me!

2.verse: Let my prayer be counted as incense before you,

3.verse: Set a guard, O Lord , over my mouth;

4.verse: Do not let my heart incline to any evil,

5.verse: Let a righteous man strike me—it is a kindness;

6.verse: When their judges are thrown over the cliff,

7.verse: As when one plows and breaks up the earth,

8.verse: But my eyes are toward you, O God , my Lord;

9.verse: Keep me from the trap that they have laid for me

10.verse: Let the wicked fall into their own nets,

1.verse: With my voice I cry out to the Lord ;

2.verse: I pour out my complaint before him;

3.verse: When my spirit faints within me,

4.verse: Look to the right and see:

5.verse: I cry to you, O Lord ;

6.verse: Attend to my cry,

7.verse: Bring me out of prison,

1.verse: Hear my prayer, O Lord ;

2.verse: Enter not into judgment with your servant,

3.verse: For the enemy has pursued my soul;

4.verse: Therefore my spirit faints within me;

5.verse: I remember the days of old;

6.verse: I stretch out my hands to you;

7.verse: Answer me quickly, O Lord !

8.verse: Let me hear in the morning of your steadfast love,

9.verse: Deliver me from my enemies, O Lord !

10.verse: Teach me to do your will,

11.verse: For your name's sake, O Lord , preserve my life!

12.verse: And in your steadfast love you will cut off my enemies,

8.verse: The Lord is gracious and merciful,

12.verse: to make known to the children of man your mighty deeds,

1.verse: Praise the Lord !

2.verse: I will praise the Lord as long as I live;

3.verse: Put not your trust in princes,

4.verse: When his breath departs, he returns to the earth;

5.verse: Blessed is he whose help is the God of Jacob,

6.verse: who made heaven and earth,

8.verse: the Lord opens the eyes of the blind.

1.verse: Praise the Lord !

2.verse: The Lord builds up Jerusalem;

3.verse: He heals the brokenhearted

4.verse: He determines the number of the stars;

5.verse: Great is our Lord, and abundant in power;

6.verse: The Lord lifts up the humble;

7.verse: Sing to the Lord with thanksgiving;

8.verse: He covers the heavens with clouds;

9.verse: He gives to the beasts their food,

10.verse: His delight is not in the strength of the horse,

11.verse: but the Lord takes pleasure in those who fear him,

12.verse: Praise the Lord , O Jerusalem!

13.verse: For he strengthens the bars of your gates;

14.verse: He makes peace in your borders;

15.verse: He sends out his command to the earth;

16.verse: He gives snow like wool;

17.verse: He hurls down his crystals of ice like crumbs;

18.verse: He sends out his word, and melts them;

19.verse: He declares his word to Jacob,
